item.title: World now sees twice as many days over 50C
item.description: BBC research finds the number of days passing 50C has doubled in the past 40 years.

item.title: Hurricane Nicholas brings heavy rain to Texas and Louisiana
item.description: Meteorologists warn of life-threatening flooding, power outages and storm surges.

item.title: Afghanistan crisis: Taliban kill civilians in resistance stronghold
item.description: The militants target civilians in Panjshir, the BBC finds, despite promises of restraint.

item.title: Met Gala 2021: Celebrities show off lavish outfits in New York
item.description: This year's famous guests were inspired by everything from the Matrix to the Statue of Liberty.

item.title: Apple rushes to block 'zero-click' iPhone spyware
item.description: The flaw allows hackers to access devices even if users do not click on a link or file.

item.title: What's gone wrong with the 'War on Terror' in Africa?
item.description: Twenty years after the US 'War on Terror' began, Islamist movements have spread across Africa.

item.title: Norway's centre-left defeats Solberg's conservative rule
item.description: Prime Minister Erna Solberg concedes victory in elections, paving the way for coalition talks.

item.title: California recall election: Biden campaigns with Gavin Newsom
item.description: Polls show the state's Democratic Governor Gavin Newsom has a comfortable lead ahead of the vote.

item.title: China's latest Covid outbreak linked to primary school
item.description: Reports suggest the outbreak could be linked to a student's father who returned from Singapore.

item.title: Climate change: Young people very worried - survey
item.description: Over half of respondents in a survey believe humanity is doomed and governments are failing to act.

item.title: Afghan women hit back at Taliban with #DoNotTouchMyClothes campaign
item.description: Afghan women show off their traditional dress as black burqas spread under the Taliban.

item.title: Canada federal election: A look at the key numbers driving the campaign
item.description: A visual guide to the big issues in Canada's federal election, from climate to cost of living.

item.title: Covid: Which countries are vaccinating children and why?
item.description: Millions of children around the world are being offered a Covid vaccine.

item.title: Russia election: Opposition crushed ahead of managed polls
item.description: Exiled or disqualified, opposition voices warn of a government stitch-up in this weekâ€™s elections.

item.title: German election: Hunger strikers want greater action on climate change
item.description: Six young people say they won't end their hunger strike until the leading candidates meet them.

item.title: Why even giant ships can't solve the shipping crisis
item.description: A shortage of vessels is hampering global trade and may lead to empty shelves before Christmas.

item.title: World War Two: The forgotten Indian soldiers of Dunkirk
item.description: Some 300 Indian soldiers were evacuated from the coast of France during a pivotal moment in World War Two.

item.title: Amazon's Cape Town base: The battle to save South African culture
item.description: Some indigenous groups say the planned office in Cape Town is on culturally important land.

item.title: Life at 50C: The toxic gas flares fuelling Nigeria's climate change
item.description: Joy and her family are among 2m Nigerians living within 4km of a gas flare in Nigeria's oil-rich south.

item.title: Twenty years after 9/11, will al-Qaeda rise again?
item.description: Where is al-Qaeda 20 years after the 9/11 attacks - and could it re-emerge as a terror threat?

item.title: China's coronavirus-fuelled surfing boom
item.description: Covid restrictions that have limited foreign travel have led to a boom in surfing in China.

item.title: Why North Korea keeps launching missiles
item.description: North Korea keeps testing missiles despite international condemnation. Why does Pyongyang persist?

item.title: 'My dad was killed in first hate-crime after 9/11'
item.description: The story of the first American to be killed in the backlash - a turbaned Sikh man in Arizona.
